result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Bail/bond hearing on November 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defn is eligible for SPD services but has not been assigned an atty yet

Defendant Avion S Vaccaro in court, in custody and without counsel.  Attorney Cecilia DeMarco in court for State of Wisconsin.
Status conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on November 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on October 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

10:58 AM Defendant Avion S Vaccaro in court in custody.  Attorney Annie Jay in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared without counsel. Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:26 AM Defendant Avion S Vaccaro in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Annie Jay in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defn qualified for SPD, still working on appointing. CT addresses time limits. CT finds good cause to go outside of time limits. CT sets PH w/ co defn.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Avion S Vaccaro
Current: 115 W Doty St, c/o Dane County Jail, Madison, WI 53703 United States  (Effective: 08-31-2022)
Prior: 3506 Dawes St, Madison, WI 53704 United States

Cash bond is set in the amount of $150,000 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
_x_ Regardless of when cash bail (if required) is posted, or when a signature bond is signed, the jail shall only release the defendant if the defendant can  be outfitted directly by Pretrial Services with any required equipment prior to the defendant being released from the jail. (PRIOR APPROVAL BY PRETRIAL SERVICES REQUIRED) 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _x_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with ICM, RTM, or Jamari M.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with KEPW or any family member of KEWP.
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
- Defendant shall surrender all currently valid passports issued in their name to the Clerk of Court. 
- Defendant shall not leave Dane County without prior approval of the Court. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 5
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)

3:40 PM Defendant Avion S Vaccaro in court, in custody.  Attorney Luis C Cuevas in court for Avion S Vaccaro.  Prosecuting attorney Thersa Louise Lewandowski in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.
